private_information: I know the set of places: depot0, depot1, depot2, distributor0
I know initial crate locations: crate0 at depot1, crate1 at depot0, crate2 at distributor0
I know pallet locations: pallet0 at depot0, pallet1 at depot1, pallet2 at depot2, pallet3 at distributor0
I know truck locations: truck0 at depot0, truck1 at depot0, truck2 at distributor0
Road connectivity: trucks can drive between any two depots or distributors
depot_planner.goal: Transport and place crates so that crate0 is on crate2, crate1 is on pallet2, and crate2 is on pallet3

private_information: I know hoists and their initial positions and availability: hoist0 at depot0 available, hoist1 at depot1 available, hoist2 at depot2 available, hoist3 at distributor0 available
I know that hoists can lift, drop, load into trucks, and unload from trucks
I know surface types: pallets and crates are surfaces so crates can be stacked
hoist_operator.goal: Coordinate hoist operations to enable loading, unloading, lifting and dropping to achieve the global placement goal

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties
I check that action preconditions and effects are explicitly represented and that no implicit bookkeeping shortcuts remain
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report ensuring plans are temporally and causally consistent and free of bookkeeping shortcuts

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent analyses into a single PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global placement goal

public_information: A depot is a type of place
A distributor is a type of place
A pallet is a type of surface
A crate is a type of surface
Trucks can drive between any two depots or distributors along roads
Actions available: drive truck, hoist lift from surface, hoist drop to surface, hoist load crate into truck, hoist unload crate from truck
Drive precondition: truck must be at the origin place
Drive effect: truck moves to destination and is no longer at origin
Hoist lift preconditions: hoist at same place as crate, hoist available, crate clear
Hoist lift effects: crate not at place, hoist is lifting the crate, hoist becomes not available, source surface becomes clear, crate not on that surface
Hoist drop preconditions: hoist and surface at same place, surface clear, hoist lifting the crate
Hoist drop effects: hoist becomes available, hoist is not lifting the crate, crate at place, surface not clear, crate is clear, crate on surface
Hoist load preconditions: hoist and truck at same place, hoist is lifting the crate
Hoist load effects: crate is in the truck and no longer on a surface, hoist becomes not available while holding status is reflected appropriately
Hoist unload preconditions: hoist at same place as truck, hoist available, crate is in the truck
Hoist unload effects: crate not in truck, hoist becomes not available, hoist is lifting the crate

analysis.system_prompt: You are the depot planning specialist. Produce a structured analysis describing places, initial object placements, reachable transports by trucks, and candidate high-level movement sequences required to reach the goal. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem files. Provide any assumptions you need to resolve ambiguities explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Agent depot_planner context: use public information and your private information to list explicit state variables, identify required moves of crates between places, and propose ordering constraints among moves. If information is missing, describe what is missing rather than assuming it.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the hoist operations specialist. Produce a structured analysis of hoist capabilities, lift/drop/load/unload preconditions and effects instantiated for the current objects and places, and propose sequences of hoist actions needed to implement the high-level moves. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem files.
analysis.prompt: Agent hoist_operator context: using public and private information, enumerate concrete hoist action instances that will be necessary, including required availability transitions and surface clearances. List any concurrency constraints or resource conflicts.

audit.system_prompt: You are the temporal and causal auditor. Analyze the analyses produced by planners and hoist operator and produce an audit report that identifies implicit bookkeeping, temporal shortcuts, omitted preconditions or effects, and suggests canonical explicit predicates and constraints to eliminate such shortcuts. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem files.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor context: inspect the planned sequences and resource usages for temporal and causal anomalies, propose explicit predicates and causal links to ensure correctness, and provide a prioritized list of corrections to be integrated by the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and FastDownwards-compatible encodings. Integrate the analyses and the audit report and produce a single complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing agent-specific action schemas where appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure all preconditions and effects are explicit, avoid bookkeeping shortcuts, and include any required typing and predicates.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator context: combine agent analyses and audit corrections into a sound PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal: crate0 on crate2, crate1 on pallet2, crate2 on pallet3. Ensure the encoding is compatible with FastDownwards and documents any modeling choices as comments within the PDDL files.
